greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of graphs on n labeled nodes, each node being colored with one of k colors, where no edge connects two nodes of the same color.
comment: Not all colors need to be used.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1274
R. C. Read, The number of k-colored graphs on labelled nodes, Canad. J. Math., 12 (1960), 410-414.
R. C. Read, E. M. Wright, Colored graphs: A correction and extension, Canad. J. Math. 22 1970 594-596.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := n!*2^Binomial[n, 2]*SeriesCoefficient[Sum[ x^i/(i!* 2^Binomial[i, 2]), {i, 0, nmax}]^k, {x, 0, n}];
Table[T[n - k, k], {n, 0, nmax}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 23 2019 *)
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 01 2018
